Detailed Description

Reusable methods for generating touch events.

These methods can be used with InstrumentationTestCase to simulate user interaction with the application through a touch screen.

Definition at line 19 of file TouchUtils.h.

static void gaia::testing::TouchUtils::drag ( core::Instrumentation *  inst,
float  fromX,
float  toX,
float  fromY,
float  toY,
int32_t  stepCount 
) [static]

Simulate touching a specific location and dragging to a new location.

Parameters:
instThe instrumentation of the test
fromXX coordinate of the initial touch, in screen coordinates
toXXcoordinate of the drag destination, in screen coordinates
fromYY coordinate of the initial touch, in screen coordinates
toYY coordinate of the drag destination, in screen coordinates
stepCountHow many move steps to include in the drag

static int32_t gaia::testing::TouchUtils::dragWidgetTo ( core::Instrumentation *  inst,
core::Widget *  w,
int32_t  gravity,
int32_t  toX,
int32_t  toY 
) [static]

Simulate touching a widget and dragging it to a specified location.

Parameters:
instThe instrumentation of the test
wThe widget that should be dragged
gravityWhich part of the widget to use for the initial down event. A combination of (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
toXFinal location of the widget after dragging
toYFinal location of the widget after dragging
Returns:
distance in pixels covered by the drag

static int32_t gaia::testing::TouchUtils::dragWidgetToX ( core::Instrumentation *  inst,
core::Widget *  w,
int32_t  gravity,
int32_t  toX 
) [static]

Simulate touching a widget and dragging it to a specified location.

Only moves horizontally.

Parameters:
instThe instrumentation of the test
wThe widget that should be dragged
gravityWhich part of the widget to use for the initial down event. A combination of (TOP, CENTER_VERTICAL, BOTTOM) and (LEFT, CENTER_HORIZONTAL, RIGHT)
toXFinal location of the widget after dragging
Returns:
distance in pixels covered by the drag

Simulate touching a widget and dragging it to a specified location.

toYFinal location of the widget after dragging

distance in pixels covered by the drag
static void gaia::testing::TouchUtils::getLocationOnScreen ( core::Widget *  w,
int32_t *  location 
) [static]

Computes the coordinates of the widget on the screen. The argument must be an array of two integers. After the method returns, the array contains the x and y location in that order.

Parameters:
wThe widget that need be get location
locationan array of two integers in which to hold the coordinates
